commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: I wonder when she's going to come back?

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Hasn't it been way too long now?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I didn't think we'd stop seeing her altogether after that... She loves this club.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: She's contacting almost 1,000 different people. It sounds like she has no time at all.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: How many people has she managed to reach? Do you think she'll come tomorrow?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I don't know...

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: I really think it's crazy for her to be trying to reach so many people all by herself.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: We wanna help her out too.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: Yeah, that would be much more efficient.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I told her that when we talked yesterday, but she said she wants to do everything herself... She told me to focus on what I should be doing.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: I guess so, but I'm so worried about her I can hardly concentrate on that.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: It feels like we're nothing more than strangers if she says she wants to do it all on her own.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Yeah...

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I mean, I'm super grateful that she's working so hard on our behalf... I really am, but...

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: I wish she'd lean on us a little more. Are we that unreliable?

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: I feel a little sad that she won't rely on us.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: You know, I don't want to bum us all out by saying this, but if she's not around then it doesn't even feel worth it to practice.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: I totally understand. Whenever I do a good job, she praises me and tells me how amazing I am... So it's hard to not have someone like that around anymore.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: And she always looked so happy to be watching us practice. Whenever I saw that, I'd start to have more fun too.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: Whenever she was here, it felt like practice finished in a flash. But now...

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Yeah. Now it feels like the time just drags on. Plus, this room feels kinda empty without her.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: I really wish she'd at least just pop in and say hi.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I do too.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Uehara?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Uehara!

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: What? Oh, Shioriko... What is it?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: That's what I want to know. You looked lost in thought, but you should watch where you're going.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Sorry.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: You seem pretty down. Was the situation with the volunteers that much of a shock? You shouldn't let it bother you, that's just how things are.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I actually think it's quite impressive that you managed to get so many people to show up...

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: No, that's not what's bothering me, exactly.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Then what is it?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I mean, of course it was a shock that not enough volunteers showed up to the session. But that's not it...

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Um, I guess I'm having a hard time explaining it.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I'd be happy to listen to you. It's all right if you can't find the right words. Just tell me what you're feeling.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Thank you, Shioriko.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Should we go somewhere we can talk?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Yeah...

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Oh, I see. So that's what's been going on.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I've never seen her like this before. I don't know what to do...

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I know, did you ever give her the present we got the other day?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: No, not yet. We were going to have a small gathering after the info session, and I planned to give it to her there...

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: But after what happened, it wasn't the time. And besides, she hasn't come to club practice at all since then, so her old notebook isn't even filled up yet.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: You should start by giving her the present. She's a sharp girl, but right now she is so overwhelmed that she's blinded to those around her.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: That gift is filled with the love you all have for her... So I'm sure she'll pick up on how you feel when she sees the messages that everyone has written.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: You really think so?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Yes, I really do. Let me set up a time for you two to talk.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: What? But... Won't that be too much trouble for you?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: No, not at all. Actually, I think I'm partially responsible for things turning out this way, so please let me help.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Thank you, Shioriko!
